intro: Roepera aurantiaca subsp. cuneata, commonly known as the orange roepera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in shrubland habitats and has hairy, ovate leaves with a distinct cuneate base. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
